intro: Aciotis indecora, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, disturbed soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. The plant features a rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its small, fluffy seeds are dispersed by the wind, allowing it to colonize new areas effectively. Aciotis indecora is often found in desert scrublands and is considered a hardy, resilient species in harsh environments.
